Comment: This command info is generated from fig
Name: asr
Description: Asr efficiently copies disk images onto volumes, either directly or via a multicast network stream

Arguments.Name: --buffers
Arguments.Description: One of the options that control how asr uses memory

Arguments.Name: num
Arguments.Description: num

Arguments.Name: --buffersize
Arguments.Description: One of the options that control how asr uses memory

Arguments.Name: size
Arguments.Description: size

Arguments.Name: --csumbuffers
Arguments.Description: One of the options that control how asr uses memory

Arguments.Name: num
Arguments.Description: num

Arguments.Name: --csumbuffersize
Arguments.Description: One of the options that control how asr uses memory

Arguments.Name: size
Arguments.Description: size

Arguments.Name: --verbose
Arguments.Description: Enables verbose progress and error messages

Arguments.Name: --debug
Arguments.Description: Enables other progress and error messages

Arguments.Name: help
Arguments.Description: Displays asr usage information

Arguments.Name: version
Arguments.Description: Displays asr version

Arguments.Name: restore
Arguments.Description: Restores a disk image or volume to another volume

Arguments.Name: --source
Arguments.Description: Can be a disk image, /dev entry, or volume mountpoint

Arguments.Name: source
Arguments.Description: source

Arguments.Name: --target
Arguments.Description: Can be a /dev entry, or volume mountpoint

Arguments.Name: target
Arguments.Description: target

Arguments.Name: --file
Arguments.Description: When performing a multicast restore, --file can be specified instead of --target

Arguments.Name: source
Arguments.Description: source

Arguments.Name: --erase
Arguments.Description: Erases target and is required. --erase must always be used, as file copies are no longer supported by asr

Arguments.Name: --format
Arguments.Description: Specifies the destination filesystem format

Arguments.Name: HFS+ | HFSX
Arguments.Description: HFS+ | HFSX

Arguments.Name: --noprompt
Arguments.Description: Suppresses the prompt which usually occurs before target

Arguments.Name: --timeout
Arguments.Description: Specifies num seconds that a multicast client should wait when no payload data has been received over a multicast stream before exiting

Arguments.Name: num
Arguments.Description: num
num

Arguments.Name: --puppetstrings
Arguments.Description: Provide progress output that is easy for another program to parse

Arguments.Name: --noverify
Arguments.Description: Skips the verification steps normally taken to ensure that a volume has been properly restored

Arguments.Name: --allowfragmentedcatalog
Arguments.Description: Allows restores to proceed even if the source's catalog file is fragmented

Arguments.Name: --SHA256
Arguments.Description: Forces the restore to use the SHA-256 hash in the image during verification

Arguments.Name: --sourcevolumename
Arguments.Description: Tells asr which volume in the source container to invert when doing an APFS restore

Arguments.Name: --sourcevolumeUUID
Arguments.Description: Tells asr which volume in the source container to invert when doing an APFS restore

Arguments.Name: --useReplication
Arguments.Description: Forces asr to use replication for restoring APFS volumes

Arguments.Name: --useInverter
Arguments.Description: Forces asr to use the inverter for restoring APFS volumes

Arguments.Name: --toSnapshot
Arguments.Description: Specifies the snapshot on the source APFS volume to restore to the target APFS volume

Arguments.Name: --fromSnapshot
Arguments.Description: Names a snapshot on the source APFS volume to use in combination with --toSnapshot to specify a snapshot delta to restore to the target APFS volume

Arguments.Name: restoreexact
Arguments.Description: Same as restore verb, except that for an HFS Plus volume, the target partition is resized to match the size of the source partition/ volume

Arguments.Name: --source
Arguments.Description: Can be a disk image, /dev entry, or volume mountpoint

Arguments.Name: server
Arguments.Description: Multicasts source over the network

Arguments.Name: --source
Arguments.Description: Source has to be a UDIF disk image

Arguments.Name: source
Arguments.Description: source

Arguments.Name: --interface
Arguments.Description: The network interface to be used for multicasting

Arguments.Name: interface
Arguments.Description: interface

Arguments.Name: --config
Arguments.Description: Server requires a configuration file to be passed

Arguments.Name: configuration
Arguments.Description: configuration

Arguments.Name: imagescan
Arguments.Description: Calculate checksums of the data in the provided image and store them in the image

Arguments.Name: info
Arguments.Description: Report the image metadata which was placed in the image by a previous use of the imagescan verb

Arguments.Name: --plist
Arguments.Description: Writes its output as an XML-formatted plist
